sentences.english: When we are cursing about the viciousness of the snake, we are actually pleased about its existence.
sentences.chinese: 我們在詛咒蛇的惡毒的同時卻又在慶幸它的存在。

sentences.english: One situation in particular kept me grateful to still be alive.
sentences.chinese: 有一次的突發狀況讓我一直慶幸自己還活着。

sentences.english: So, thankfully I know I have storage space for return values.
sentences.chinese: 很慶幸我們爲返回值預留了存儲空間。

sentences.english: I feel very lucky, I still know, no self-deception life.
sentences.chinese: 我很慶幸，我還是知道了，沒有自欺欺人一生。

sentences.english: When he is felicitous, he hears there's enormous roaring from the deep cliff.
sentences.chinese: 正在慶幸的時候，他聽到斷崖深處傳來巨大的吼聲。

sentences.english: Much to my relief the car was not damaged.
sentences.chinese: 令我非常慶幸的是車並沒有損壞。

sentences.english: He said, "Happily unemployed." And then he said, "So, Brooke!
sentences.chinese: 他說，是呀，我很慶幸我是無業遊民。

sentences.english: Thankfully ATIC has very deep pockets.
sentences.chinese: 值得慶幸的阿蒂奇有很深的口袋。

sentences.english: She looked across the wangs eyes, also read the glad and rejoice in it.
sentences.chinese: 她望向對面王星的雙眼，也在其中讀出了慶幸與歡喜。

sentences.english: We have all experienced days when everything goes wrong .
sentences.chinese: 我們都曾經歷過諸事慶幸的日子。

sentences.english: For ten years of insistency, I have no regret being through all of these.
sentences.chinese: 十年來的堅持，我很慶幸參與了這一切。

sentences.english: Huang is glad to have somewhere he can put his skills to their fullest use .
sentences.chinese: 黃宗翰慶幸自己擁有一個能發揮專長的工作空間。

sentences.english: Consider your- self fortunate if you do not work for this type of company.
sentences.chinese: 你該慶幸，倘若你沒有在這種任人唯親的公司工作。

sentences.english: Fortunately, the eyes of Chinese people have been illuminated by blood.
sentences.chinese: 慶幸的是，中國人民的眼睛也漸漸被血洗亮了。

sentences.english: How thankful I am to have been rebuked in love rather than flattered in dishonesty.
sentences.chinese: 我慶幸自己能夠被愛心責備，而不受虛假的諂媚。

sentences.english: I’m really glad they didn’t do that in the films.
sentences.chinese: 我真的很慶幸他們沒在電影當中呈現出來。

definition: to feel sad/to feel unwell/(of life) to be difficult
happy/glad/willing (to do sth)/in a cheerful mood
to feel happy/to rejoice/to have a great time/to make fun of sb
to become aware/to detect/to realize/to perceive
to grieve/to be broken-hearted/to feel deeply hurt
only/merely/no more than/but/however/anyway (to get back to a previous topic)/cannot be more (after adjectival)
